experience_requirements: 4+ years hands-on experience developing and deploying computer vision models in real-world applications
Strong experience in cosmetic or defect grading applications in manufacturing, logistics, or visual inspection environments
Proven track record with image classification, segmentation, and object detection
Solid Python skills and experience with deep learning frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow)
Strong understanding of image preprocessing methods (normalization, augmentation, filtering)
Experience working on cloud platforms, preferably AWS
Proven ability to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams (software, hardware, product)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
key_responsibilities: Design, train, and deploy deep learning models (CNNs) for fine-grained visual inspection and defect detection
Apply image analysis techniques such as segmentation, feature extraction, and contrast enhancement to improve model accuracy
Build Cosmetic Grading models to classify surface conditions and assign quality grades
Address inconsistencies in human annotations using labeling strategies, consensus modeling, uncertainty quantification, or human-in-the-loop feedback
Architect and manage image data pipelines from acquisition to annotation and model training
Collaborate with software engineers, QA teams, and hardware support teams to productionize models
education_requirements: Bachelor's degree in Telecommunications Engineering (Radiocommunications Orientation) – National University of Río Cuarto
University Diploma in Data Science – National University of Córdoba / MundosE Córdoba (2024)
Machine Learning Specialization – Stanford University Online (2025)
nice_to_have: Cosmetic or defect grading domain knowledge in manufacturing
Extensive domain experience in manufacturing/visual inspection environments
Experience with large-scale deployment of CV systems in industry
Experience with multilingual communication or bilingual technical documentation
key_projects: SABIA-Mar satellite mission L0 processing subsystems
Launched AI division and expanded to CV/Industry 4.0
Datathon Río Cuarto 2024 – LLM chatbot for bullying prevention
career_growth: Path from engineering to product ownership and AI leadership
Opportunity to lead CV initiatives in manufacturing environments
special_instructions: Output must be structured JSON following the JobRequirements model schema.
No code blocks or extraneous formatting.

strengths: Strong CV and ML foundation with hands-on deployment
Cloud and data pipeline experience (AWS, Airflow, Docker/K8s)
gaps: Direct track record in cosmetic defect grading is not shown in CV
Explicit experience in manufacturing quality standards may be limited

score_explanation: Technical skills score (0.871) reflects strong proficiency in Python, PyTorch, TF/Keras, OpenCV, CV techniques, data pipelines, AWS, and containerization, aligning well with key job requirements.

Soft skills score (0.90) reflects demonstrated cross-functional leadership, stakeholder communication, mentoring, and multilingual communication, which match the collaboration and communication demands of the role.

Experience score (0.85) accounts for 7+ years total in related activities (CV, AI, production systems) with leadership experience; some domain-specific cosmetic/grading experience is not clearly shown.

Education score (0.80) recognizes relevant engineering background plus data science and ML specialization; while not a traditional CS degree, the candidate has strong data science credentials and practical ML training.

Industry score (0.70) acknowledges experience in manufacturing-adjacent domains (industrial plant CV, satellite missions) but not explicit cosmetic-grade manufacturing or logistics domain; potential ramp-up needed for cosmetics-specific contexts.

Overall match (0.85) indicates a strong fit with room to grow in cosmetics-specific domain and domain-specific production workflows. Key strengths—CV/ML deployment, cloud pipelines, leadership; primary gaps—cosmetic grading domain knowledge and manufacturing quality processes.
